newsitem.title: UK: Littlewoods ends Freemans talks with Sears.
newsitem.headline: Littlewoods ends Freemans talks with Sears.

text.p: Britain's largest private company Littlewoods said on Friday that it has withdrawn from talks with retailer Sears Plc over the purchase of Sear's agency mail order business Freemans.
It said in a statement that it has become clear that Sears is in talks with other parties.
"In these circumstances Littlewoods has decided to discontinue its current discussions. Littlewoods will await the decision by the MMC on whether to lay aside the reference," said Littlewoods.

Sears signed a conditional agreement to sell Freemans to Littlewoods Organisation for 395 million pounds in January, but the sale hit a snag when the monopolies and mergers commission (MMC) mounted a probe into the proposed sale.
The deal would have have given mail-order-to -football pools group Littlewoods around 25 percent of the UK mail order market.
"With or without Freemans, Littlewoods is a key player in home shopping and is a leading business with excellent prospects," said James Ross, chairman of Littlewoods.
By 1337, shares in Sears had fallen 2-1/2 pence on the news to stand at 79-1/2.
